There's nothing against the rules involving getting upset and expressing yourself negatively. It's not encouraged, but it happens. We're human.

The line is when you allow negativity to grow to the point where it becomes harassment, or when it's so pervasive that you take over the chat with it and drown out everybody else. 

Nobody is expecting everyone to be a zen master when they play the game, and I've never stated otherwise.

Yes, you have. You told me yourself in another post that speaking up for yourself in game to counter harassment/trolling is an offense worthy of  chat restriction.

I'm no lawyer and I don't work for Riot. If I've contradicted myself or used imprecise language, my apologies. I'm just a guy.

The point I'm trying to get across is that Riot's stance on negativity in-game is NOT zero-tolerance, unless that negativity involves hate speech or calls for violence. The original post here shows VERY minor negativity, which I would be EXTREMELY surprised to see trigger any punishment whatsoever. 

Speaking up for yourself isn't punishable if done REASONABLY. I had a bad game yesterday in which I badly lost my lane, and my jungler asked for me to be reported for inting in /all chat. I told him I wasn't trolling and I'm simply having a bad game (and lagging a bit). I didn't feel the need to immediately mute and report him. The line not to be crossed is when "speaking up for yourself" becomes engaging in a flame-war that takes over the chat log. THAT is punishable. 

If my explanation here isn't sufficient for you, link me the thread where I stated otherwise and I'll do my best to reconcile my posts for your information.

Personally? I would classify it as a minor offense, he's just whining a bit. But like I said in my other comment, for this to be a permanent ban right off the hop on an other wise clean account is kind of suspect. So it's in my opinion that either this isn't the full logs, or the system is bugged and showing him the wrong logs (This has happened before).

You can continue attacking my character and motives, but it won't really have any effect on me, surprised you haven't noticed that yet.

You wont get a premaban instantly, you need about 6-9 games flaming overall and 2-3 games of flaming close together, doesnt matter how many games you played. he 100% had some prior shit going on, im perma as well. played for years, had every champ a lot of skins. i actually was VERY toxic back in the dasy and had a 2000 game chat restriction. that was 2-3 years ago. last year i had some minor restrictions.. this year however... had a bad day and flamed a bit: 2 week ban... 3 months and like 200 games later i stopped smoking and had another bad day: permaban.

to be fair i was most likely reported quite a few out of the 200 other games by maybe a player or two after not putting up with their bullshit or getting too emotional when people group mid for the 4th time when mid inhib is already down and we couldnt finish the 3 times before... but whatever

To me it looks like they found out, that it is more lucrative to ban players because they are kind of addicted by now and will spend a lot of money on their new account.

Why on earth would they stop the "you have been reported, everyone has bad days but be chill" messages after a toxic game that got you reported? They want you to get banned.

If you think about it a bit, for the whole community its actually not just positive, silver/gold is INFESTED with banned smurfs which makes it a pain for casual players.
They apparently took that warming out because it was confusing too many people. People thought they were being punished when the pop up happened.

I'd also mention that like below, there may be an incorrect chat log showed, and/or this person may have had a 14 day ban before and have forgotten about it (there's a couple gaps in play long enough within their recent history).

Otherwise, I agree that this merits Riot review.
Third thought, could it be one of those charge back bans?

Chargebacks don't give chat logs. There were a few cases a few weeks ago where people were handed the wrong chat logs for their punishments, which could be the case here, but again would require contacting support.

Is that really the whole unedited log they gave you?  It usually doesn't show just one game.

I suppose it is possible the punishment is concerning something you said in champ select or post-game lobby for this game, which are not shown in the log.

If that really is everything it may be a system error, because that does not look restriction worthy.
